instructions.title: SURFACE PREPARATION
instructions.data:
Allow new concrete to dry for 14-28 days under normal weather conditions before painting.
Painting over a roughened concrete floor is recommended to improve adhesion of succeeding coats.
Remove oil and grease by using detergents or degreasers.
Surface to be painted should be clean and dry, free from dust, dirt, contaminants, and all loose grit and mortar.

instructions.title: PAINTING SCHEDULE
instructions.data: Mix 3 parts of BOYSEN®® Epoxy Primer White B‑2200 to 1 part of its catalyst. Allow 20 minutes induction time. Thin the prepared mixture with BOYSEN®® Epoxy Reducer B‑55 in a 1:1 ratio. Apply as primer coating on bare concrete floors. Let dry overnight. Mix 3 parts BOYSEN®® Epoxy Enamel and 1 part of its catalyst. Allow 20 minutes induction time. Apply 2 to 3 coats of prepared BOYSEN®® Epoxy Enamel. Allow 8 hours to overnight before recoating.

instructions.title: NOTES
instructions.data: Use only BOYSEN®® Epoxy Reducer as thinning solvent. Application of topcoat should be done within 7 days after priming to ensure good intercoat adhesion, otherwise re-application of primer is needed. Allow the product to cure for 3 days for foot traffic abrasion and 7 days for heavy-duty use.

calculator.title: Primer
calculator.item: BOYSEN®® Epoxy Primer White B‑2200

calculator.title: For repainting, complete removal to bare substrate is necessary.
